intro: Manettia calycosa var. scaberrima, commonly known as the rough manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or vine, often found in humid, shaded environments. The varietal name "scaberrima" refers to its rough or prickly texture, which is a distinctive botanical feature.
